Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton went off for 25 points and 10 assists.
Myles Turner blocked a shot by Buddy Hield during the first half.
Spencer impressed with a career-high 17 points off the bench.
Pascal Siakam contributed 25 points and 11 rebounds.
Myles Turner added 11 points, seven rebounds, and three blocks.
Gui Santos provided a lift off the bench with 11 points, three steals, and three assists.
Quinten Post scored his first career 3-pointer.
Pascal Siakam broke away for consecutive dunks, part of an 8-0 Indiana blitz.
Pre-Game Insights: Steph Curry and Draymond Green sat out as the Warriors handle the veterans with caution on the second night of a back-to-back.
Andrew Wiggins was home for personal reasons.
Jonathan Kuminga is out for at least two more weeks with a bad ankle sprain.
Brandin Podziemski is dealing with an abdominal strain.
Gary Payton II is on the mend but not quite ready to return from a calf strain.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr commented on the team's effort, stating, 'Shorthanded, back-to-back, guys did a great job of hanging in there.'
Spencer reflected on his performance, saying, 'We were shorthanded, I had to be aggressive.'
Steve Kerr mentioned the potential of Quinten Post, 'If Quinten can develop, he could be a real threat for us and give us a totally different look offensively.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors racked up deflections, offensive rebounds, and forced turnovers.
Indiana had won 10 of its last 13 games entering Friday night.
